page.title: 08Visitors to Pendlebury
page.content: The{Gay Willows Hotel}was built 100 years ago in 1885, as a pit managers house and was originally called Elm House. The{Coal Board}owned it first but the Anderson family bought it in 1954 so they've owned it for 31 years. People come to stay from all over {England}and some from{Russia, China, {Japan, Malaya, Thailand, South America {U.S.A., South Africa and Africa. A lot of commercial travellers stay at the hotel whilst visiting such local industries as{BOC}and{Chloride. The cost for one night bed and breakfast is Â£16.50 and lunches are served from 12am until 2pm. Lots of people are employed in the hotel and restaurant including{waiters {cooks, cleaners, cleaners, maids, bar- {staff and people who wash up.
